results.title: Avalon: the 1992 Australian International Air Show
results.creator_credit: Geoff Tanner, Cathie Scott, Neil Brown, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder and Apocalypse
results.brief_description: In October 1992 the largest gathering of aircraft in Australia took place at Avalon Airport, Victoria. The five day air show was the biggest ever held in the Southern Hemisphere. A complete range of aircraft operated by the Australian Defence Forces, general aviation aircraft, warbirds, recreational and sport aircraft, airliners, antiques, balloons, radio-controlled models, hang-gliders and helicopters have all been recorded in static or spectacular flying displays on this video. Presented by Jeff Watson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Tanner, Cathie Scott, Neil Brown, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder and Apocalypse

results.title: Autopsie D'un Temoignage = Autopsy of a Witness
results.brief_description:
Elizabeth Massot has taken time off to move into a new appartment. From her windows, she witnesses a cat burgler breaking into a roof-top flat. Elizabeth and an other witness are taken by the police to give their testimony. Elizabeth’s testimony is that of a cautious woman used to ponder the frailty of human evidence. As such, she closely observes the other witness giving an incredibly detailed description of the burgler while enjoying all the attention: is she a reliable witness or just a bored woman relishing her 15 minutes of fame?

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Philippe Condroyer ; writers, Philippe Condroyer, Mariette Condroyer ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Marie Dubois, Patrick Bouchitey.

results.title: Automation : see it now
results.creator_credit: Edward Murrow and Fred W Friendly
results.brief_description: A documentary report on the modern day industrial revolution, Automation. It traces the earlier mechanization in industry and shows the application of the newer automation in present-day industry. Between the extremes of considering automation a menace to our way of life, or as the solution of every problem, the film presents viewpoints on the subjects ranging from a working man to the head of I.B.M. All state it is inevitable. Automation is shown in such industries as the automotive, aviation, baking, electronics, manufacturing industries and many others.

results.title: Autistic child: a behavioural approach
results.creator_credit: William Rose and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Describes some of the characteristic behaviours exhibited by autistic children and illustrates the use of detailed behavioural techniques to teach language and apropriate behaviour. Shows how training in language and social skills can make a dramatic difference in outcome for autistic children.

results.title: Australian Trams in the Sixties. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Reviewing the sights of Australia’s city streets during the swinging ‘60’s brings back all the memories of those wonderful times. This video features Brisbane’s trams from the mid-sixties up until the closure of the system; Flinders and Collins Streets in Melbourne, where we see tramcars; Ballarat, with its mixture of bogie and four wheel cars; Bendigo, for a variety of types including the single truck Birney trams; and the last route to survive in Adelaide’s once extensive system, the Glenelg line.

results.title: Australians because of business
results.brief_description: A comprehensive two part program examining the successes and failures of the Australian Business Migration Program. The first part examines the history of the ABMP which was set up in the early 1980’s to entice successful entrepreneurs to Australia. Seventy percent of applicants to the ABMP were from Taiwan and Hong Kong and two years into their residency in Australia, close to half the applicants were still not involved in creating business opportunities for themselves in their new country. The second part of the program examines some of the problems encountered by business migrants including language difficulty, encountering a different commercial culture in Australia and negotiating an indifferent government bureaucracy.

results.title: Australian snakes
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the four families of snakes found in Australia: pythons, elapids, colubrids, and typhlops. Highlights differences in colour, size, pattern, habitat and temperament. Narrated by Max Taylor. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: A comprehensive survey of the four families of snakes found in Australia: pythons, elapids, colubrids, and typhlops. Highlights differences in colour, size, pattern, habitat and temperament. Narrated by Max Taylor. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australians at war: 1939-1945: navy, army, airforce
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
During the years 1956-1969 Frank Bagnall produced a series tracing the involvement of the Army, Navy and Airforce services during the Second World War. The series is comprised almost entirely of actual footage and is united by the themes of human effort and sacrifice. The individual episodes are available separately in the collection on 16mm. NAVY: illustrates the conditions of active service in the Royal Australian Navy in the war including missions such as an Island invasion with America, and defending bases in New Guinea and Northern Australia. ARMY: records the Australian soldier’s participation in the Second World War. Covers fighting in Libya, Greece, Crete, Syria and Tripoli, and the Singapore, New Guinea and Borneo campaigns. AIRFORCE: Australian airmen serve their country admirably, earning distinction in areas as widely separated as New Guinea and Europe. Victory comes at a cost however as machines and men are lost in the name of conflict. Repackaged by Film Australia in 1995.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_moP0lr2s1w
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSlHLFAQlGg&t=13s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3A6szu1ca0Y&t=25s
